CutSceneText.Text: Would you believe me if I said that you could carry an Obelisk onto the battlefield
so you cannot die in battle? Well, it is true.
There are portable Obelisks known as Kisks.
You can use a Kisk to set up a resurrection bind point on the battlefield.
Your bind point will be wherever you place the Kisk.
But you must remember, a Kisk doesn't last forever,
and depending on the size of the Kisk, only so many Daevas can bind their souls to it.
Despite those limits, a Kisk is essential when you lay siege to a fortress.
If your Kisk is destroyed, your Daevas will resurrect at the permanent Obelisk to which they last bound their souls.
Those Daevas cannot swiftly return to the battlefield, so your siege might falter.
Therefore, you must do whatever you can to keep the Kisk safe from harm.
